Hi - I'm attempting to introduce junit testing techniques into where I work.
So far I've used it on a small scale, writing junit tests for enhancement
changes to existing code.
We have some large projects, along the lines of web booking engines for
travel agents, that already exist. One of the concerns that I (and
developers) have is that we will end up with thousands of test cases, many
of which will involve using substantial amounts of MockObjects to set up
test cases and that all this will become too much of an overhead to manage &
maintain. Specifically,  that changing code in the future will involve
analysis of not only the project code but also the junit test code - an
overhead we don't have today of course.

Has anyone applied junit on a large scale such as this? I'd love to hear
comments about pros & cons and lessons learned etc.

Rgds,
Kevin.
